soester-anzeiger.de.151520.2: New York City - Over the past two years, climate activist Greta Thunberg has attracted attention with her tireless commitment to the "Fridays For Future" movement.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.3: Now she spoke about her plans for the future and her meeting with US President Donald Trump at the UN climate summit last year in a well-known late-night show.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.4: Latenight host Stephen Colbert welcomed 17-year-old Thunberg to your show on Tuesday and conducted a lengthy interview with the Swede.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.5: She not only talked about her fight against climate change, but also about her conflict with the world's powerful.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.6: "There are some things that surprised me," she said.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.7: "How far people go to steer the focus away from the climate crisis," she said.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.8: "Everything from organized hate campaigns to threats, just because a group of children takes to the streets" she had experienced.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.9: "FC Bayern has a turnover of 750 million euros, Borussia Dortmund 500 million and RB Leipzig 300 million.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.10: Heads of state and leading politicians who ridicule or even try to silence them on social media find them "funny" because they show the reactions "because they have no other answer".
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.11: It became particularly interesting at the end of the interview when Greta Thunberg was addressed to a well-known scene in which she threw a bitter look at US President Trump.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.12: At the UN Climate Summit 2019 in New York, for which the Aktvistin sailed across the Atlantic, her expressive view was captured by the cameras and has since been seen by countless people on the Internet.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.13: The short clip became a GIF, an animated image that ultimately became one of the most frequently used images for Trump opponents.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.14: But what did the 17-year-old think about the US president at this moment?
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.15: To Stephen Colbert's question, which was relatively open, she answered only briefly and dry: "To be honest, I do not think this requires any further explanation."
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.16: The experienced satirist Colbert had probably not expected the quick-witted answer and disappeared from the picture laughing.
soester-anzeiger.de.151520.17: With her "How dare you?" speech on the principles of climate protection, she was remembered by many at the climate conference.

morgenpost.de.276366.4: Fleetwood Mac co-founder Peter Green died
morgenpost.de.276366.5: His life was like a rollercoaster ride: after a rapid ascent with Fleetwood Mac it went steeply downhill and then slowly up again.

mittelbayerische.de.307290.1: Ingenious guitarist, drug junkie, cult follower: The co-founder of the band Fleetwood Mac, Peter Green, is dead.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.2: He died peacefully in his sleep at the age of 73, family members announced in an official statement on Saturday that another statement would be announced for the next few days.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.3: Top musicians like Peter Frampton praised Green as one of the best blues and rock guitarists.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.4: Mick Fleetwood spoke in an emotional response of a "monumental loss" for all previous and current members of the band Fleetwood Mac.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.5: The other 15 clubs have an average budget of 130 million, "said the 58-year-old.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.6: The drummer Fleetwood and the guitarist Green had founded the now legendary band in 1967 in London, his dreamy instrumental hit "Albatross" is unforgettable to this day.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.7: The musician's life ("The End Of The Game", "In The Skies") resembled a rollercoaster ride.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.8: With Fleetwood Mac Green experienced a rapid rise - but the band celebrated their greatest successes without him.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.9: There was controversy, among other things, because Green wanted to donate all the profits of the group to charity.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.10: He began to appear in wide robes and with a large crucifix.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.11: Psychological problems also played a role.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.14: The blues rock guitarist suffered from drug abuse and schizophrenia, as biographers reported.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.15: For a long time, Green was treated in psychiatry.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.16: With a view to the past, Grindel feels betrayed.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.17: During most of the 1970s, the musician disappeared from the scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.18: He is said to have lived on the street, worked as a cemetery gardener and spent some time in an Israeli kibbutz.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.19: Green was born in Bethnal Green, London, the son of a Jewish working-class family.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.20: At a young age, he became enthusiastic about US blues musicians such as B.B. King and Muddy Waters.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.21: At the age of eleven he learned to play the guitar.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.22: At the age of 15, the teenager began playing the guitar professionally and five years later got the chance to be on stage as lead guitarist for the instrumental band Peter B's Looners.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.23: He was replaced by his idol Eric Clapton.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.24: In the midst of the blues boom, Green founded Fleetwood Mac in the summer of 1967 together with his Bluesbreakers colleagues Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.25: The song "Albatross", composed by Green, gave the group their first number 1 hit in the winter of 1968 / 69 and catapulted them to the top of the British music scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.26: But the rapid rise soon showed its downsides: Green could not cope with the media bustle, his experiments with the drug LSD became more and more extreme.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.27: He later commented on the life between music and addiction in an interview: "The worst thing that happened to me in life are the drugs - the best was to land a number 1 hit".
mittelbayerische.de.307290.28: "Unfortunately, there have been people who have noticed this mistake and pierced the press instead of addressing me," said Grindel about the adoption of an expensive watch that led to his resignation in April 2019.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.29: Towards the end of the decade, Green surprisingly achieved success in 1979 with an album inspired by religious themes.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.30: Fleetwood Mac, meanwhile, floated on a wave of success without him in a new formation.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.31: Their 1977 album "Rumours" sold more than 40 million copies worldwide.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.32: Despite several minor solo successes, Green did not make a major comeback until 1996, when he rejoined a group of fellow musicians.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.33: The British Daily Telegraph spoke of a rock star returning to Earth.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.34: Green released several albums with the Peter Green Splinter Group before the band broke up in 2004.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.35: For music experts he was already a blues legend during his lifetime - and with his gentle sound one of the most influential guitarists of the past decades.
